finx.utils.concurrency

author: dick mule purpose: utils for facilitating concurrency of methods

finx.utils.concurrency.task_runner(task: Coroutine, loop: asyncio.AbstractEventLoop = None)

Run async task in event loop. If loop is not running, create new loop.

  • loop (asyncio.AbstractEventLoop) – Event loop to run task

async run_async(*args, **kwargs)

Run function async. Makes it so that an async hybrid function can always be specified as a coroutine for parallel tasks.

tasks = [some_fn.run_async(i) for i in range(10)]
results = await asyncio.gather(*tasks)
Parameters:

  • args (tuple) – All args to be passed to function

  • kwargs (dict) – All kwargs to be passed to function

Returns:

Async result of function

Return type:

Any

property event_loop

Property returning protected _event_loop

Returns:

finx.utils.concurrency.hybrid(f: Callable) → Hybrid

Decorator to make function hybrid

@hybrid
async def awaitable_fn():
    await asyncio.sleep(1)
    return "done"

class SomeClass:
    ...

    @hybrid
    async def awaitable_fn(self):
        await asyncio.sleep(1)
        return "done"
Parameters:

f (Callable) – Function to be wrapped

Returns:

Hybrid object

Return type:

Hybrid
